title: Executive Order 8784-Partial Revocation of Certain Executive Orders Creating Public Water Reserves: Public Water Restoration No. 88
content: By virtue of the authority vested in me by section 1 of the act of June 25, 1910, c. 421, 36 Stat. 847, the Executive orders of January 3, 1917, August 18, 1932, and April 17, 1926, creating respectively Public Water Reserves Nos. 41, 145, and 107, are hereby revoked so far as they pertain to or affect the following-described lands in California and New Mexico:
In Public Water Reserve No. 41, of January 3, 1917:
T. 18 S., R. 1 E., sec. 29, NW¼.In Public Water Reserve No. 145, of August 18, 1932:
T. 3 S., R. 3 E., sec. 12, all.
In Public Water Reserve No. 107, of April 17, 1926, as construed by Department of the Interior Interpretation No. 137, of October 18, 1930:
citation: Franklin D. Roosevelt, Executive Order 8784-Partial Revocation of Certain Executive Orders Creating Public Water Reserves: Public Water Restoration No. 88 Online by Gerhard Peters and John T. Woolley, The American Presidency Project https://www.presidency.ucsb.edu/node/372118
